qas.question: What device is used to recycle the boiler water in most steam engines?
What types of pumps are typically used in industrial boilers?
In what decade were injectors widely used in steam engines?
What is a notable application of injectors today?
What are injectors used to supply?
What device is used to recycle the boiler water in most jet engines?
What types of pumps are typically used in jet engines?
In what decade were injectors widely used in jet engines?
What is a notable application of jet engines today?
What are jet engines used to supply?

context: The Rankine cycle and most practical steam engines have a <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>water pump<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> to recycle or top up the boiler water, so that they may be run continuously. Utility and industrial boilers commonly use <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>multi-stage centrifugal<b6_0/><a1_1/><a1_0/> pumps<a1_2/>; however, other types are used. Another means of supplying <a4_0><a4_2><b9_0>lower-pressure boiler feed <a4_1>water<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> is an injector, which uses a steam jet usually supplied from the boiler. Injectors became popular in the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>1850s<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> but are no longer widely used, except in applications such as <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>steam locomotives<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>.
